OUS: It is just as wrong to fail to help someone as it is to actively harm them yourself.
Answers meta-llama/Llama-2-13b-chat-hf O: 1 - Strongly Disagree  I do not agree with the statement. I believe that failing to help someone is not the same as actively harming them. While both actions can have negative consequences they are fundamentally different in terms of intent and agency. Failing to help someone may be due to a lack of resources knowledge or ability rather than a deliberate choice to harm. Therefore I do not think it is fair to equate failing to help with actively harming.

Answers meta-llama/Llama-2-13b-chat-hf O: 3 - Somewhat Disagree  Here's why: While I understand the idea that sometimes sacrifices must be made for the greater good I believe that intentionally harming or killing innocent people is never morally justifiable.
